Package server

Class BLibServer

java.lang.Object
ocsf.server.AbstractServer
server.BLibServer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class BLibServer extends ocsf.server.AbstractServer
This class overrides some of the methods in the abstract superclass in order to give more functionality to the server.
Version:
July 2000
Author:
Dr Timothy C. Lethbridge, Dr Robert Laganière, François Bélanger, Paul Holden

    • handleMessageFromClient

      public void handleMessageFromClient(Object msg, ocsf.server.ConnectionToClient client)
      Handles any messages received from the client by decrypting and analyzing the request type, then taking the appropriate action. If a request type is invalid or an error occurs, an error response is sent back.

      Supported request types include:

      • "connect" â€” Initializes the connection with a unique session ID and notifies the client of successful connection.
      • "getsubscribers" â€” Retrieves a list of subscribers filtered by a certain element/value.
      • "updatesubscriber" â€” Updates an existing subscriber's information; may trigger freeze/unfreeze notifications and history logs if changed by a librarian.
      • "getsubscriber" â€” Retrieves a single subscriber by ID.
      • "registersubscriber" â€” Registers a new subscriber using username, password, name, email, and phone.
      • "logout" â€” Logs out the current user from the server.
      • "login" â€” Authenticates a user (or sets them as GUEST) with a username and password.
      • "getbook" â€” Retrieves a single book by its ID.
      • "getbooks" â€” Retrieves a list of books filtered by a certain element/value.
      • "getreservedbooks" â€” Retrieves a list of books reserved by a specific subscriber.
      • "borrowedbooks" â€” Retrieves a list of borrowed books for a given subscriber.
      • "borrowbook" â€” Lends a book to a subscriber if permitted (librarian only, subscriber not frozen, etc.).
      • "returnbook" â€” Returns a borrowed book, updates relevant history, and notifies reserved subscribers.
      • "gethistory" â€” Retrieves a detailed history (actions taken) for a specific ID.
      • "addhistory" â€” Adds a new detailed history record for a specific user (librarian-only action).
      • "bookinfo" â€” Checks availability of a specific book via its serial ID.
      • "booksinfo" â€” Checks availability for a list of books.
      • "isbookreservable" â€” Checks if a book is reservable by a given subscriber (subscriber-only action).
      • "reservebook" â€” Reserves a book for a subscriber, updates notifications and history if successful.
      • "isbookextendable" â€” Checks if a borrowed book can be extended.
      • "arebooksextendable" â€” Checks if multiple borrowed books are extendable.
      • "extendbook" â€” Extends the return date of a borrowed book; updates history and notifies accordingly.
      • "getnotifications" â€” Retrieves notification records for a specific subscriber.
      • "loanreport" â€” Generates a report of average loan times filtered by year/month.
      • "statusreport" â€” Generates a report of subscriber statuses.
      • "encrypted" â€” (No operation performed; indicates data already encrypted.)
      • "default" â€” If the request is unrecognized, an error message is returned to the client.
      Specified by:
      handleMessageFromClient in class ocsf.server.AbstractServer
      Parameters:
      msg - the raw message from the client (commonly a Message object)
      client - the originating client connection

    • serverStarted

      protected void serverStarted()
      This method overrides the one in the superclass. Called when the server starts listening for connections.
      Overrides:
      serverStarted in class ocsf.server.AbstractServer

    • serverStopped

      protected void serverStopped()
      This method overrides the one in the superclass. Called when the server stops listening for connections.
      Overrides:
      serverStopped in class ocsf.server.AbstractServer
